newsitem.title: UK: Eurobonds anticipate few deals in week ahead.
newsitem.headline: Eurobonds anticipate few deals in week ahead.

text.p: The Eurobond market entered its quietest period of the year without even a whimper, recording no new issues of any note during Monday's morning session.

While further league table-related activity and a few small structured deals from LatAm borrowers were expected later in the week, mainstream primary market business will remain at a virtual standstill until after the year-end break.
Then, as ever in early January, a splurge of issuance will hit the market causing new year bullishness to turn to talk of oversupplied markets inside a fortnight.
Last week's activity brought the volume of international bonds launched this year to around $665 billion, $200 billion more than last year's record-breaking total.
Late in the morning, Compagnie Parisienne de Reescompte added 200 million French francs to the 1.0 billion franc 10-year TEC-10 deal it originally launched on December 9.
